title: QA-Kayser Conic Optics Certificate: JWST TMA Validation
abstract: This certificate formalizes the engineering validation of Kayser's conic section harmonics via the James Webb Space Telescope's three-mirror anastigmat (TMA) optical design. JWST uses an ellipsoid-hyperboloid-ellipsoid configuration where each mirror surface is a conic section with specific geometric parameters. We document the confirmed specifications and map the conic classification to QA orbit structure.

engineering_system.name: James Webb Space Telescope (JWST)
engineering_system.purpose: Aberration-free imaging over wide field of view

conic_section_theory.definition: A conic section is defined by conic constant K where the surface equation is: z = (r²/R) / (1 + sqrt(1 - (1+K)(r/R)²))
conic_section_theory.kayser_source: kayser4.png - Parabel, Hyperbel, Ellipse diagrams showing harmonic projections

tertiary_mirror.note: Fixed mirror in aft optics system

validation_tests.name: TMA Configuration Match
validation_tests.criterion: Primary K in (-1,0), Secondary K < -1, Tertiary K in (-1,0)
validation_tests.note: Primary and tertiary conic constants not publicly specified but TMA class constrains them to ellipsoid

validation_tests.name: Kayser Diagram Correspondence
validation_tests.claim: JWST mirrors instantiate all three non-degenerate conic types shown in Kayser's diagrams
validation_tests.note: JWST uses ellipse where Kayser also shows parabola; Paul-Baker TMA designs use parabola primary

qa_orbit_mapping.hypothesis: The three conic section types map to QA's three orbit classes

proposed_correspondence.qa_property: shorter cycle, higher curvature in state space

proposed_correspondence.conic_property: boundary case, single branch to infinity

qa_orbit_mapping.upgrade_path: Derive conic equations from QA basin boundaries; compare eccentricities to orbit period ratios

engineering_significance.why_tma_works: TMAs achieve anastigmatic imaging (zero spherical aberration, coma, and astigmatism) by balancing Seidel coefficients across three mirror surfaces with complementary conic geometries
engineering_significance.kayser_interpretation: Kayser's claim that conic sections arise from harmonic projections is validated by their appearance in precision optical systems optimized for aberration-free imaging
engineering_significance.physical_principle: Conic surfaces are the natural geometries for focusing electromagnetic radiation because they preserve wavefront coherence across reflection

certificate_summary.primary_claim: JWST's TMA optical system provides engineering validation that conic section geometry—central to Kayser's harmonic theory—manifests in precision instruments
limitations: Primary and tertiary conic constants not publicly available
QA orbit-to-conic mapping is structural analogy, not proven isomorphism
LinkedIn comment identified parabola primary (Paul-Baker type), but JWST actually uses ellipse primary
